at0000.1.description: وثيقة لتوصيل المعلومات للآخرين, عادة كاستجابة لطلب من طرف آخر.
*Document to communicate information to others, commonly in response to a request from another party.(en)
Document to communicate information to others, commonly in response to a request from another party.
Documento para comunicar información a otros, comunmente en respuesta a la solicitud de un tercero.
Documento para comunicar informações a outros, comumente em resposta a uma solicitação de terceiros.
Dokument som brukes for å kommunisere informasjon til andre, ofte som svar på en forespørsel.
Ein Dokument zur Übermittlung von Informationen an andere, meist als Antwort auf eine Anfrage.
일반적으로 다른 상대의 요청에 대한 응답으로, 다른 사람들과 정보를 통신하는 문서.
Asiakirja tiedon välittämiseksi muille, vastauksena yleensä toisen osapuolen pyyntöön.
Documento per comunicare informazioni ad altri, comunemente in risposta ad una richiesta di un altro soggetto.
Document om informatie met anderen te communiceren, vaak op verzoek van een andere partij.
Dokument för att förmedla information till andra, vanligen som svar på en begäran från en annan part.
用于交流信息的文件，通常是为了响应某一方的请求

en.purpose: To record additional composition metadata aligned with IHE-XDS which is not already available from the Reference Model COMPOSITION class.
en.use: Use to add IHE-XDS aligned metadata to a COMPOSITION.context, which along with existing COMPOSITION attributes, allows the composition to be registered in an IHE-XDS environment.

at0002.1.description: A high-level document class code, normally selected from a valueset provided by the IHE-XDS Affinity Domain.
at0002.1.comment:
For example: Report, Summary, Images, Plan, Patient Preferences, Workflow.
These codes are specific to an XDS Affinity Domain.

at0002.1.description: *A high-level document class code, normally selected from a valueset provided by the IHE-XDS Affinity Domain. (en)
at0002.1.comment:
*For example: Report, Summary, Images, Plan, Patient Preferences, Workflow.
These codes are specific to an XDS Affinity Domain. (en)

at0002.1.description: *A high-level document class code, normally selected from a valueset provided by the IHE-XDS Affinity Domain. (en)
at0002.1.comment:
*For example: Report, Summary, Images, Plan, Patient Preferences, Workflow.
These codes are specific to an XDS Affinity Domain. (en)

de.purpose: Zur Darstellung der Ergebnisse einer bildgebenden Untersuchung einer bestimmten Körperstruktur oder -region und deren Interpretation mit radiologischen Verfahren.
keywords: Bild, Radiologie, Modalität, Röntgen, CT, Ultraschall, MRI, Diagnostik, Scan, Röntgenbild, X-Ray, Bildgebung, biomagnetisch, Densitometrie, Tomographie, Radiographie, magnetisch, Resonanz, Mammographie, Nuklear, Medizin, Positron, PET, Angiographie, Fluoroskopie
de.use:
Zur Darstellung der Ergebnisse einer bildgebenden Untersuchung einer bestimmten Körperstruktur oder -region und deren Interpretation mit radiologischen Verfahren.

Dieser Archetyp wurde entwickelt, mit dem Fokus auf die Befundung und Interpretation einer einzelnen bildgebenden Untersuchung (entspricht einer einzelnen DICOM-Studie). Verweise auf DICOM-bezogene Attribute sind enthalten, aber der Schwerpunkt liegt auf der Darstellung eines klinischen Berichts zu einer bildgebenden Untersuchung und nicht auf der Darstellung von DICOM-bezogenen Attributen, die in einem Radiologieinformationssystem (RIS) erwartet werden könnten. Spezifische Angaben über die DICOM-Serie können mithilfe von Archetyp CLUSTER.imaging_series dargestellt werden, der im SLOT „Seriendetails“ verschachtelt ist.

Detaillierte Befunde, die während einer bildgebenden Untersuchung beobachtet wurden und auf eine bestimmte Körperstruktur oder -region abzielen, können dargestellt werden, indem der Archetyp CLUSTER.imaging_exam und/oder seine Gruppe spezialisierter Archetypen innerhalb des SLOTs „Strukturierte bildgebende Befunde“ in diesem Archetyp verschachtelt werden. Es ist beabsichtigt, dass im Laufe der Zeit die spezifischen Informationen in jeder Spezialisierung erweitert werden, um Befunde mit allen bildgebenden Modalitäten einzubeziehen.

Wird eine bildgebende Untersuchung im Rahmen einer komplexeren Aktivität durchgeführt, wie z. B. eines interventionellen chirurgischen Eingriffs, sollte der bildgebende Befund mit diesem Archetyp erfasst werden.
Strukturierte Angaben über den chirurgischen Eingriff und verabreichte Medikamente oder Kontrastmittel sollten unter Verwendung der ACTION.procedure- bzw. ACTION.medication-Archetypen dargestellt werden. In dieser Situation wird empfohlen, alle verwandten Archetypen innerhalb derselben Templates zu repräsentieren.

Dieses Ergebnis wird dem anfordernden Kliniker normalerweise als eine Komponente im Kontext eines auf COMPOSITION-basierenden Gesamtberichts berichtet.
de.misuse:
Nicht zur Darstellung von Ergebnissen von körperlichen Untersuchung verwenden. Verwenden Sie zu diesem Zweck den Archetyp CLUSTER.exam und/oder seine Gruppe spezialisierter Archetypen.

Darf nicht verwendet werden, um die Funktionalität oder Spezifikationen eines radiologischen Informations- oder Quellsystems zu replizieren.

Darf nicht verwendet werden, um strukturierte Angaben zu einem durchgeführten Verfahren darzustellen. Verwenden Sie für diesen Zweck die spezifischen prozedurbezogenen Archetypen, wie z. B. den Archetyp ACTION.procedure.

Nicht zur Darstellung von strukturierten Anaben über Medikamente, die während des radiologischen Untersuchung verabreicht werden. Verwenden Sie für diesen Zweck spezifische medikamentenbezogene Archetypen, wie z. B. den Archetyp ACTION.medication.

Darf nicht verwendet werden, um Fotos oder Videos in der Gesundheitsakte darzustellen. Verwenden Sie zu diesem Zweck den Archetyp CLUSTER.media_file.

sv.purpose: *To record the findings on imaging examination of a specified body structure or region and their interpretation, using radiological techniques. (en)
keywords: *image, radiology, modality, xray, CT, ultrasound, MRI, diagnostic, scan, x-ray, imaging, biomagnetic, densitometry, tomography, radiography, magnetic, resonance, mammography, nuclear, medicine, positron, PET, angiography, fluoroscopy (en)
sv.use:
*Use to record the findings on imaging examination of a specified body structure or region and their interpretation, using radiological techniques.

This archetype has been designed to focus on the reporting of findings and interpretation associated with a single imaging examination (equivalent to a single DICOM study). References to DICOM-related attributes are included but the focus is on the representation of a clinical report from an imaging examination and not on representing DICOM-related attributes that might be expected within a radiology information system. Specific details about the DICOM series can be recorded using the CLUSTER.imaging_series nested within the 'Series details' SLOT.

Detailed findings observed during an imaging examination and targeting a specified structure or region can be recorded by nesting the CLUSTER.imaging_exam and/or its family of specialised archetypes within the 'Structured imaging findings' SLOT in this archetype. It is intended that over time the specific detail in each specialisation will grow to include findings using all imaging modalities.

If an imaging examination is carried out as part of a more complex activity, such as a surgical operation carried out under imaging guidance, the imaging findings should be recorded using this archetype. 
Structured details about the surgical procedure and medications or contrast administered should be recorded using the ACTION.procedure and/or ACTION.medication archetypes, respectively. In this situation, it is recommended that all related archetypes should be reported within the same template.

This result will normally be reported back to the requesting clinician as one component within the context of an overall COMPOSITION-based report. (en)
sv.misuse:
*Not to be used to record findings on physical examination. Use the CLUSTER.exam and/or its family of specialised archetypes for this purpose.

Not to be used to replicate the functionality or specifications of a radiology information or source system.

Not to be used to record structured details about any procedure undertaken. Use the specific procedure-related archetypes, such as ACTION.procedure archetype for this purpose.

Not to be used to record structured details about medications administered during the imaging test. Use specific medication-related archetypes, such as the ACTION.medication archetype for this purpose.

Not to be used to record photographs or videos  within the health record. Use the CLUSTER.media_file archetype for this purpose. (en)

nb.purpose: For å registrere funn på og tolkning av bilder som er gjort ved radiologiske metoder på spesifikke strukturer eller regioner i kroppen.
nb.use:
Brukes for å registrere funn på og tolkning av bilder som er gjort ved radiologiske metoder på spesifikke strukturer eller regioner i kroppen.

Denne arketypen har blitt laget med fokus på svarrapportering av funn og tolkning en enkelt bildediagnostisk undersøkelse (tilsvarende en enkelt "DICOM Study"). Referanser til DICOM-relaterte attributter er inkludert, men fokuset er på representasjonen av en klinisk rapport fra en bildeundersøkelse og ikke på å representere DICOM-relaterte attributter som kan forventes i et radiologiinformasjonssystem (RIS/PACS). Spesifikke detaljer om DICOM-serien kan registreres ved å nøste arketypen CLUSTER.imaging_study_details i SLOT'et "Detaljer om undersøkelsesserier".

Detaljerte funn som er gjort ved en bildediagnostisk undersøkelse som er rettet mot en spesifikk struktur eller region i kroppen, kan registreres ved å nøste CLUSTER.imaging_exam (Bildediagnostisk undersøkelse - kroppsstruktur) eller en av de spesialiserte CLUSTER.imaging_exam arketypene i SLOT'et "Strukturerte funn" i denne arketypen. Det er tenkt at det over tid vil det bli utviklet slike spesialiseringer som hver for seg omhandler funn fra alle modaliteter.

Hvis den bildediagnostiske undersøkelsen er en del av en mer kompleks prosedyre, som en kirurgisk operasjon som utføres under bildeveiledning, skal de radiologiske funn og observasjoner bli registrert i denne arketypen. Strukturerte detaljer om den kirurgiske prosedyren og administrasjon av medikasjon eller kontrast bør registreres i henholdsvis ACTION.procedure (Prosedyre) og/eller ACTION.medication (Legemiddelhåndtering). I dette tilfelle anbefales det at alle relaterte arketyper, som detaljer om prosedyren eller administrasjon av medikasjon/kontrast bør samles i det samme templatet.

Svaret på bildediagnostikken vil normalt sett bli rapportert tilbake til den bestillende kliniker som en komponent innenfor rammen av en samlet COMPOSITION-basert rapport.
nb.misuse:
Skal ikke brukes til funn ved fysiske undersøkelser. Bruk CLUSTER.exam (Undersøkelsesfunn) eller dennes gruppe av spesialiserte arketyper for dette formålet.

Skal ikke brukes til å replikere funksjonaliteten til et radiologi informasjonssystem (RIS/PACS) eller kildesystem.

Skal ikke brukes til å registrere strukturerte detaljer om en klinisk prosedyre som er gjennomført. Bruk da de spesifikke arketypene for prosedyre-relatert innhold, for eksempel ACTION.procedure (Prosedyre).

Brukes ikke til å registrere informasjon om legemidlene som administreres under en bildediagnostisk undersøkelse. Bruk da de spesifikke legemiddelrelaterte arketypene, for eksempel ACTION.medication (Legemiddelhåndtering).

Skal ikke brukes til å lagre fotografier eller video i den elektroniske journalen. Bruk arketypen CLUSTER.media_file (Mediafil) for dette formålet.

en.purpose: To record the findings on imaging examination of a specified body structure or region and their interpretation, using radiological techniques.
keywords: image, radiology, modality, xray, CT, ultrasound, MRI, diagnostic, scan, x-ray, imaging, biomagnetic, densitometry, tomography, radiography, magnetic, resonance, mammography, nuclear, medicine, positron, PET, angiography, fluoroscopy
en.use:
Use to record the findings on imaging examination of a specified body structure or region and their interpretation, using radiological techniques.

This archetype has been designed to focus on the reporting of findings and interpretation associated with a single imaging examination (equivalent to a single DICOM study). References to DICOM-related attributes are included but the focus is on the representation of a clinical report from an imaging examination and not on representing DICOM-related attributes that might be expected within a radiology information system. Specific details about the DICOM series can be recorded using the CLUSTER.imaging_series nested within the 'Series details' SLOT.

Detailed findings observed during an imaging examination and targeting a specified structure or region can be recorded by nesting the CLUSTER.imaging_exam and/or its family of specialised archetypes within the 'Structured imaging findings' SLOT in this archetype. It is intended that over time the specific detail in each specialisation will grow to include findings using all imaging modalities.

If an imaging examination is carried out as part of a more complex activity, such as a surgical operation carried out under imaging guidance, the imaging findings should be recorded using this archetype. 
Structured details about the surgical procedure and medications or contrast administered should be recorded using the ACTION.procedure and/or ACTION.medication archetypes, respectively. In this situation, it is recommended that all related archetypes should be reported within the same template.

This result will normally be reported back to the requesting clinician as one component within the context of an overall COMPOSITION-based report.
en.misuse:
Not to be used to record findings on physical examination. Use the CLUSTER.exam and/or its family of specialised archetypes for this purpose.

Not to be used to replicate the functionality or specifications of a radiology information or source system.

Not to be used to record structured details about any procedure undertaken. Use the specific procedure-related archetypes, such as ACTION.procedure archetype for this purpose.

Not to be used to record structured details about medications administered during the imaging test. Use specific medication-related archetypes, such as the ACTION.medication archetype for this purpose.

Not to be used to record photographs or videos  within the health record. Use the CLUSTER.media_file archetype for this purpose.

at0004.1.text: Code of the study to be published (Accession Number)
at0004.1.description: The name of the imaging examination performed.
at0004.1.comment: For example: 'CT abdomen'; 'Doppler ultrasound of renal artery' or 'Plain chest xray'. Coding with a terminology is strongly recommended, preferably a term specifying both modality and anatomical location, where possible. Examples of candidate terminologies are the LOINC Imaging Document Codes, RadLex Playbook or SNOMED-CT. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.code in FHIR.

at0061.1.description: Narrative description about the reason the examination was originally requested.
at0061.1.comment: Also known as 'Clinical question' or 'Clinical query'.

at0014.1.description: Narrative description of relevant clinical history that provides context for the examination and interpretation of results.
at0014.1.comment: Alternatively this data element can include an RM link to clinical information provided in the original examination request or located elsewhere within the health record.

at0008.1.description: Narrative description or overview of all clinical findings.

at0056.1.description: Narrative description about the comparison of this examination with previous similar studies.
at0056.1.comment: Also use this data element to indicate if no comparison images and/or reports are available. Details about the images used for comparison can be recorded using the 'Comparison study details' CLUSTER, within Protocol.

at0021.1.description: Narrative concise, clinically relevant interpretation of all imaging findings, and include a comparison with previous studies where appropriate.
at0021.1.comment: Also referred to as 'Opinion' or 'Conclusion'. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.conclusion in FHIR.

at0059.1.description: Suggestion for further imaging, investigations and/or referral, and associated rationale.
at0059.1.comment: This data element has 0..* occurrences to allow for more than one recommendation. Formal orders for additional imaging examination, investigation should be recorded using an INSTRUCTION archetype, such as INSTRUCTION.service_request.

at0023.1.description: Additional narrative about the examination not captured in other fields.
at0023.1.comment: For example: a note that the film was given to the patient. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.note in FHIR.

at0023.2.description: Additional narrative about the examination not captured in other fields.
at0023.2.comment: For example: a note that the film was given to the patient. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.note in FHIR.

at0104.1.text: HC3 document number used to associate the report or study being published.
at0104.1.description: Unique identifier for the imaging report assigned by the radiology service.
at0104.1.comment: As one instance of this archetype is used per study, this identifier can be used to connect more than one imaging study within a single combined report. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.identifier in FHIR.

at0004.1.text: Code of the study to be published (Accession Number)
at0004.1.description: Navnet på den utførte bildediagnostiske undersøkelsen.
at0004.1.comment: For eksempel: "CT abdomen", "Doppler ultralyd av nyrearterier", "Røntgen thorax". Det anbefales sterkt å bruke en terminologi der det er mulig, fortrinnsvis en kode som både spesifiserer modalitet og anatomisk lokalisering. Mulige terminologier er NCRP, LOINC, SNOMED CT eller RadLex. Vanligvis tilsvarende FIHR DiagnosticReport.code.

at0061.1.description: Tekstlig beskrivelse av begrunnelsen for henvisningen/rekvisisjonen.

at0014.1.description: Beskrivelse av relevant klinisk informasjon som er tilgjengelig på tolkningstidspunktet. Også kalt klinisk sammendrag.
at0014.1.comment: Alternativt kan dette elementet inkludere en lenke til klinisk informasjon som er gitt i den originale rekvisisjonen/henvisningen eller annet sted i den elektroniske pasientjournalen.

at0008.1.description: Tekstlig beskrivelse eller oversikt over alle funnene.

at0056.1.description: Tekstlig beskrivelse med sammenligning mellom denne undersøkelsen og tidligere lignende undersøkelser.
at0056.1.comment: Bruk også dette dataelementet for å indikere dersom ingen sammenligningsbilder og/eller rapporter er tilgjengelige. Detaljer om bildene som er brukt for sammenligning kan lagres ved å bruke det interne Clusteret "Detaljer om sammenlignende bilder" i protokolldelen av denne arketypen.

at0021.1.description: Tekstlig presis og klinisk relevant tolkning av alle funn ved bildeundersøkelsen og inkluderer en sammenligning med tidligere granskninger dersom de er passende.
at0021.1.comment: Også referert til som "Sammendrag" eller "Funn og undersøkelsesresultat". Vanligvis tilsvarerende FHIR DiagnosticReport.conclusion.

at0059.1.description: Forslag til videre bildediagnostiske undersøkelser, granskninger og/eller henvisninger, inkludert begrunnelser knyttet til dette.
at0059.1.comment: Dette dataelementet er repeterbart for å tillate flere enn en anbefaling. Bruk en INSTRUCTION-arketype for formelle henvisninger for ytterligere bildeundersøkelser, for eksempel INSTRUCTION.service_request (Helsetjenesteforespørsel).

at0023.1.description: Ytterligere kommentarer om undersøkelsen som ikke passer i andre felter.
at0023.1.comment: For eksempel et notat om at kopi av bilde eller svarrapport er gitt til pasienten. Tilsvarer DiagnosticReport.note i FHIR.

at0023.2.description: Ytterligere kommentarer om undersøkelsen som ikke passer i andre felter.
at0023.2.comment: For eksempel et notat om at kopi av bilde eller svarrapport er gitt til pasienten. Tilsvarer DiagnosticReport.note i FHIR.

at0004.1.text: Code of the study to be published (Accession Number)
at0004.1.description: Der Name der durchgeführten bildgebenden Untersuchung.
at0004.1.comment: Zum Beispiel: „CT Abdomen“, „Doppler-Ultraschall der Nierenarterie“ oder „Röntgenaufnahme des Brustkorbs“. Es wird dringend empfohlen, eine Terminologie zu verwenden, vorzugsweise einen Begriff, der sowohl die Modalität als auch die anatomische Lokalisation angibt, sofern möglich. Beispiele für mögliche Terminologien sind die LOINC Imaging Document Codes, RadLex Playbook oder SNOMED-CT. Entspricht DiagnosticReport.code in FHIR.

at0061.1.description: Die Beschreibung des Grundes für die ursprüngliche Untersuchungsanfrage.
at0061.1.comment: Auch bekannt als „Klinische Fragestellung“ oder „Klinische Frage“.

at0014.1.description: Die Beschreibung der relevanten klinischen Anamnese, die einen Kontext für die Untersuchung und Interpretation der Ergebnisse liefert.
at0014.1.comment: Alternativ kann dieses Datenelement einen RM-Link zu klinischen Informationen enthalten, die in der ursprünglichen Untersuchungsanfrage bereitgestellt wurden oder sich an anderer Stelle in der Gesundheitsakte befinden.

at0008.1.description: Die Beschreibung oder Zusammenfassung aller klinischen Ergebnisse.

at0056.1.description: Die Beschreibung zum Vergleich dieser Untersuchung mit früheren ähnlichen Studien.
at0056.1.comment: Verwenden Sie dieses Datenelement auch, um anzugeben, ob keine Vergleichsbilder und/oder Berichte verfügbar sind. Details zu den zum Vergleich verwendeten Bildern können im CLUSTER „Vergleichstudie Details“ im Archetyp-Teil "Protocol" erfasst werden.

at0021.1.description: Kurz beschriebene, klinisch relevante Interpretation aller bildgebenden Befunde und gegebenenfalls ein Vergleich zu früheren Studien.
at0021.1.comment: Auch als „Beurteilung“ oder „Gesamteindruck“ bezeichnet. Entspricht DiagnosticReport.conclusion in FHIR.

at0059.1.description: Vorschlag für weitere Bildgebung, Untersuchungen und/oder Überweisung und dazugehörige Begründung.
at0059.1.comment: Dieses Datenelement hat die Kardinalität 0..*, um mehr als eine Angabe von Empfehlung zu ermöglichen. Formelle Anordnungen für zusätzliche bildgebende Untersuchungen, Prüfungen sollten unter Verwendung eines INSTRUCTION-Archetyps wie INSTRUCTION.service_request dargestellt werden.

at0023.1.description: Zusätzliche Informationen über die Untersuchung, welche noch nicht an anderer Stelle dargestellt wurden.
at0023.1.comment: Zum Beispiel: eine Anmerkung, dass der Film dem Patienten gegeben wurde. Entspricht DiagnosticReport.note in FHIR.

at0023.2.description: Zusätzliche Informationen über die Untersuchung, welche noch nicht an anderer Stelle dargestellt wurden.
at0023.2.comment: Zum Beispiel: eine Anmerkung, dass der Film dem Patienten gegeben wurde. Entspricht DiagnosticReport.note in FHIR.

at0004.1.text: Code of the study to be published (Accession Number)
at0004.1.description: *The name of the imaging examination performed. (en)
at0004.1.comment: *For example: 'CT abdomen'; 'Doppler ultrasound of renal artery' or 'Plain chest xray'. Coding with a terminology is strongly recommended, preferably a term specifying both modality and anatomical location, where possible. Examples of candidate terminologies are the LOINC Imaging Document Codes, RadLex Playbook or SNOMED-CT. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.code in FHIR. (en)

at0061.1.description: *Narrative description about the reason the examination was originally requested. (en)

at0014.1.description: *Narrative description of relevant clinical history that provides context for the examination and interpretation of results. (en)
at0014.1.comment: *Alternatively this data element can include an RM link to clinical information provided in the original examination request or located elsewhere within the health record. (en)

at0008.1.description: *Narrative description or overview of all clinical findings. (en)

at0056.1.description: *Narrative description about the comparison of this examination with previous similar studies. (en)
at0056.1.comment: *Also use this data element to indicate if no comparison images and/or reports are available. Details about the images used for comparison can be recorded using the 'Comparison study details' CLUSTER, within Protocol. (en)

at0021.1.description: Kortfattad och kliniskt relevant tolkning av alla bilddiagnostiska fynd, inklusive en jämförelse med tidigare studier där så är lämpligt.
at0021.1.comment: *Also referred to as 'Opinion' or 'Conclusion'. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.conclusion in FHIR. (en)

at0059.1.description: Förslag för ytterligare avbildning, undersökningar och/eller hänvisning och tillhörande motiv.
at0059.1.comment: *This data element has 0..* occurrences to allow for more than one recommendation. Formal orders for additional imaging examination, investigation should be recorded using an INSTRUCTION archetype, such as INSTRUCTION.service_request. (en)

at0023.1.description: Ytterligare beskrivning av undersökningen som inte fångats i andra fält.
at0023.1.comment: *For example: a note that the film was given to the patient. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.note in FHIR. (en)

at0023.2.description: Ytterligare beskrivning av undersökningen som inte fångats i andra fält.
at0023.2.comment: *For example: a note that the film was given to the patient. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.note in FHIR. (en)

de.purpose: Zur Darstellung einer Mediendatei erworbenen und verwendeten im Bereich des Gesundheitswesens sowie der Informationen zu den zugehörigen Metadaten.
de.misuse:
Nicht zur Darstellung von Informationen, Lehr- oder Schulungsmaterial verwenden, die außerhalb des Gesundheitsprozesses generiert werden, z. B. Broschüren zur Patientenaufklärung, die dem Patienten oder der Pflegeperson zur Verfügung gestellt werden. Verwenden Sie für diesen Zweck den Archetyp CLUSTER.information_resource.

Nicht zur Darstellung von Referenz auf eine externe digitale Ressource, die als Quelle für maßgebliche Informationen oder Experteninformationen verwendet wird. Verwenden Sie für diesen Zweck den Archetyp CLUSTER.knowledge_base_reference.

sv.purpose: *To record a media file that is acquired or used as part of the healthcare process, and details about associated metadata. (en)
sv.misuse:
*Not to be used to represent information, instructional or educational material supplied to an individual, or their carer, for example patient education leaflets. Use the CLUSTER.information_resource for this purpose.

Not to be used to record a reference to a knowledge base - use CLUSTER.knowledge_base_reference for this purpose. (en)

nb.purpose: For å dokumentere detaljer om en mediafil, samt tilknyttede metadata, som er ervervet eller brukt i forbindelse med en helsetjeneste.
nb.misuse:
Skal ikke brukes til å representere informasjon, instruksjons- eller utdanningsmateriale levert til en person, eller dens omsorgsperson, for eksempel brosjyrer for pasientopplæring. Bruk CLUSTER.information_resource til dette formålet.

Skal ikke brukes til å registrere en referanse til en kunnskapsbase - bruk CLUSTER. Knowledge_base_reference for dette formålet.

sk.purpose: Na zaznamenanie mediálneho súboru, ktorý sa získa alebo použije ako súčasť procesu zdravotnej starostlivosti, a podrobností o súvisiacich metadátach.
sk.misuse:
Nesmie sa používať na reprezentáciu informácií, inštruktážnych alebo vzdelávacích materiálov dodávaných jednotlivcom alebo ich opatrovateľom, napríklad letáky s informáciami pre pacientov. Na tento účel použite CLUSTER.information_resource.

Nesmie sa používať na zaznamenanie odkazu na bázu znalostí – na tento účel použite CLUSTER.knowledge_base_reference.

en.purpose: To record a media file that is acquired or used as part of the healthcare process, and details about associated metadata.
en.misuse:
Not to be used to represent information, instructional or educational material supplied to an individual, or their carer, for example patient education leaflets. Use the CLUSTER.information_resource for this purpose.

Not to be used to record a reference to a knowledge base - use CLUSTER.knowledge_base_reference for this purpose.

nl.purpose: Om een mediabestand vast te leggen dat is verkregen of gebruikt als onderdeel van het zorgproces, en details over bijbehorende metadata.
nl.misuse:
Niet te gebruiken om informatie, instructie- of educatief materiaal weer te geven dat aan een persoon of hun verzorger wordt verstrekt, bijvoorbeeld folders voor patiënteneducatie. Gebruik hiervoor de CLUSTER.information_resource.

Niet te gebruiken om een verwijzing naar een kennisbank op te nemen - gebruik hiervoor CLUSTER.knowledge_base_reference.

at0001.1.description: Digital representation of the media file.
at0001.1.comment: If the file is stored locally, the actual content will be captured and stored using the Multimedia data type. For example: RTF or PDF for a document; JPG for an image; MP4 for a video; or WAV for an audio file. If the file is stored at a location outside of the health record, the detailed path to the file is captured using the URI attribute in the Multimedia data type. The Multimedia data type has many RM attributes such as the size of file and URI to an external source - see https://specifications.openehr.org/releases/RM/latest/data_types.html#_dv_multimedia_class.

*If the file is stored locally, the actual content will be captured and stored using the Multimedia data type. For example: RTF or PDF for a document; JPG for an image; MP4 for a video; or WAV for an audio file. If the file is stored at a location outside of the health record, the detailed path to the file is captured using the URI attribute in the Multimedia data type. The Multimedia data type has many RM attributes such as the size of file and URI to an external source - see https://specifications.openehr.org/releases/RM/latest/data_types.html#_dv_multimedia_class. (en)

Wenn die Datei lokal gespeichert wird, wird der eigentliche Inhalt erfasst und mit dem Datentyp Multimedia gespeichert. Beispiel: RTF oder PDF für ein Dokument, JPG für ein Bild, MP4 für ein Video oder WAV für eine Audiodatei. Wenn die Datei an einem Ort außerhalb der Gesundheitsakte gespeichert ist, wird der detaillierte Pfad zur Datei mithilfe des URI-Attributs im Multimedia-Datentyp erfasst. Der Multimedia-Datentyp hat viele RM-Attribute wie die Größe der Datei und URI zu einer externen Quelle - siehe https://specifications.openehr.org/releases/RM/latest/data_types.html#_dv_multimedia_class.

Hvis filen lagres lokalt, blir det faktiske innholdet lagret ved hjelp av datatypen Multimedia. For eksempel: RTF eller PDF for et dokument; JPG for et bilde; MP4 for en video; eller WAV for en lydfil. Hvis filen lagres et sted utenfor den elektroniske journalen, kan adressen til filen bli lagret ved hjelp av URI-attributtet i multimediedatatypen. Multimedia-datatypen har mange RM-attributter, for eksempel filstørrelse og URI til en ekstern kilde - se https://specifications.openehr.org/releases/RM/latest/data_types.html#_dv_multimedia_class.

Als het bestand lokaal wordt opgeslagen, wordt de daadwerkelijke inhoud vastgelegd en opgeslagen met behulp van het gegevenstype Multimedia. Bijvoorbeeld: RTF of PDF voor een document; JPG voor een afbeelding; MP4 voor een video; of WAV voor een audiobestand. Als het bestand wordt opgeslagen op een locatie buiten het medische dossier, wordt het gedetailleerde pad naar het bestand vastgelegd met behulp van het URI-attribuut in het gegevenstype Multimedia. Het gegevenstype Multimedia heeft veel RM-attributen, zoals de grootte van het bestand en de URI naar een externe bron - zie https://specifications.openehr.org/releases/RM/latest/data_types.html#_dv_multimedia_class.

Ak je súbor uložený lokálne, skutočný obsah sa zachytí a uloží pomocou dátového typu Multimedia. Napríklad: RTF alebo PDF pre dokument; JPG pre obrázok; MP4 pre video; alebo WAV pre zvukový súbor. Ak je súbor uložený mimo zdravotného záznamu, podrobná cesta k súboru sa zaznamená pomocou atribútu URI v d8tovom type Multimedia. Dátový typ Multimedia má veľa atribútov RM, ako je veľkosť súboru a URI k externému zdroju – pozri https://specifications.openehr.org/releases/RM/latest/data_types.html#_dv_multimedia_class.
